result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darenz Deshawn Haynes

records.addlTxt: Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darenz D Haynes, Pro Se, in court, in custody.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant has six cases before the court.
Counsel has not yet been appointed as to this case.
Defendant advises Court his family may obtain counsel.
Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.

Public Defender's office notified via electronic mail as to the next court date.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Darenz D Haynes in court, defendant in custody. SPD Melissa Fitzsimmons appeared as a friend of the court.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attorney Fitzsimmons informed the court that the SPD office has not been able to appoint counsel on defendant's multiple cases. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Darenz D Haynes not in court, in-custody.  Attorney John J Rejowski and Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin.  SPD Melissa Fitzsimmons appeared as a friend of the court by telephone..   CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 37 FOR BRANCH 2.  Case in court for status of counsel.  SPD has not appointed counsel as of this date. Court ordered case adjourned for hearing in Branch 37.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Darenz Deshawn Haynes in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Darenz Deshawn Haynes in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears via Zoom.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing.  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Darenz Deshawn Haynes not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Pretrial Services Discharge Report
in-custody status
JusticePoint Violation Report dated May 12, 2022 - received

Defendant Darenz Deshawn Haynes in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darenz Deshawn Haynes in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Due to the nature of the offense and defendant's lower pending matter, case is retabbed to Br. 2. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of defendant's pending matters regarding cases 19CF5544, 20CF2421, 20CF3537 and defendant's prior adjudication regarding case # 19JV898. Sworn for the State: P.O. Evan Domine - MPD.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 4 immediately upon leaving court.  
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Darenz Deshawn Haynes in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/22/22 @ 1p
